data.title: Junior Football Championship
data.meta_description: A summary of results, opposition and stats for Longford Junior Football team in Leinster & All-Ireland Championship (1906-2019)
data.text:
Junior Football Championship began in 1905 with Longford competing from 1906. Longford conceded the 1909 tie and did not compete in 1910 or 1912 or 1916. Junior grade was discontinued from 1917 to 1920 with Longford competing at Senior grade during those years. In 1921 Longford was not permitted to enter competition but was back in Leinster JFC from 1922. In 1926 Longford did not compete in JFC due to being expelled from the organisation following a dispute. There was no competition from 1943-1945. Longford did not compete in 1973 and there was no competition from 1974 to 1989. In 1994 Central Council issued a ruling preventing the use of the countyâ€™s second-best team in JFC competition, hence Longford did not compete from 1994-2001. Longford also did not compete from 2003-2008. Longford last competed in Junior Football Championship in 2019. There was no competition in 2020 or 2021 due to Covid-19. At GAA Congress in 2021, a motion was passed to change the structure of the Junior Football Championship to that of a mostly â€˜overseasâ€™ competition along with just one Irish county, Kilkenny. Todayâ€™s Junior Football Championship includes Gloucestershire, Hertfordshire, Kilkenny, Lancashire, London B, New York B, Scotland, Warwickshire & Yorkshire.

Longford played 130 games in Junior Football Championship, Won 53 (41%), Drew 7 (5%) and Lost 70 (54%).

* In 1907 the Longford victory over Westmeath in JFC was overturned on objection.

** In 1924 Longford awarded the title on objection due to Meath using a Senior player.

â€“ Junior Championship was introduced in 1905. Longford first competed in 1906.

â€“ Longford conceded the 1909 Junior Football Championship tie vs Westmeath.

â€“ Longford did not compete in the 1910, 1912 or 1916 Junior Football Championships.

â€“ Junior grade was suspended from 1917-1920 and Longford played in SFC instead.

â€“ Leinster Council did not allow Longford or Wicklow to enter competition in 1921.

â€“ 1924 Leinster JFC final was delayed until Jan 1925 due to objection from Dublin.

â€“ 1924 All-Ireland JFC final was delayed until Mar 1926 due to objection from Meath.

â€“ Longford was expelled by Leinster Council in 1926 â€“ could not compete in JFC.

â€“ Longford venue prior to 1st June 1933 was Longford Park (later greyhound track).

â€“ Longford venue from 1st June 1933 to 24th April 1937 was Longfordâ€™s Gaelic Grounds.

â€“ On 25th April 1937 Longfordâ€™s Gaelic Grounds was officially opened as Pearse Park.

â€“ No Junior Football Championship was held during the war years of 1943-1945.

â€“ Longford did not compete in Junior Football Championship in 1973.

â€“ No Junior Football Championship competition held from 1974-1982.

â€“ Longford did not compete from 1983-1989 or 1994-2001 or 2003-2008.

â€“ No Junior Football Championship held in 2020 or 2021 due to Covid-19.

â€“ JFC competition structure changed in 2021 â€“ Longford no longer involved.
